sentences.sContent: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.sCn: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

sentences.sContent: ...Conversion of paper to electronic medical records will help eliminate redundant tests and prevent drug interactions...
...and that would encourage them to think twice about whether an expensive or redundant test was worth it...
...In time it should help restrain costs by eliminating redundant tests...

synos.tran: [计]多余的，过剩的；被解雇的，失业的；冗长的，累赘的

trans.tranCn: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
trans.tranOther: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you
